Class Register

  • java.lang.Object
    • Register

  • public class Register
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Anders Alander This class creates the Register object. It holds a queue of customers and tells whether the register is open or not. This class is used by the Store class since a Store is just a number of Registers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Register()
      Constructor of Register.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Register addToQueue(Customer c)
      Creates a new customer and places him last in this register's queue.
      Register closeRegister()
      Closes the register
      boolean currentCustomerIsDone()
      Checks whether the first customer in the queue don't have any more groceries that needs registering.
      Customer getCustomer(int i) 
      Customer getDoneCustomer() 
      int getQueueLength() 
      boolean isEmpty() 
      boolean isOpen()
      Checks if the register is open.
      Register openRegister() 
      void step()
      Steps the queue forward.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Register

        public Register()
        Constructor of Register. Open will be set to false and a new queue is made.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        Steps the queue forward. It uses the help methods:

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Checks if the register is open.
        Returns:
        It returns true if the register is open else it returns false.

      • closeRegister

        public Register closeRegister()
        Closes the register
        Returns:
        It returns the register that was closed.

      • currentCustomerIsDone

        public boolean currentCustomerIsDone()
        Checks whether the first customer in the queue don't have any more groceries that needs registering.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the customer is done, else false.

      • addToQueue

        public Register addToQueue(Customer c)
        Creates a new customer and places him last in this register's queue.

      • getQueueLength

        public int getQueueLength()
        Returns:
        Returns the queue length of this register.

      • openRegister

        public Register openRegister()
        Returns:
        Opens a new register and returns it.

      • getDoneCustomer

        public Customer getDoneCustomer()
        Returns:
        Returns the ArrayList of all the done customers in this register so far

      • getCustomer

        public Customer getCustomer(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - is the index in the Registers queue. This number must be equal or greater than 0 and less than the length of the queue. The length of the queue can be fetched by @link #getQueueLength().
        Returns:
        Returns the customer at index i in the register's queue.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        Checks if the Register's queue is empty or not. Returns true if it is empty, else false.
